intro: Espostoa nana, commonly known as the dwarf espostoa, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
